body: ### Problem I have neovim nightly for daily editing. I switch to new laptop and found it always crashes when I try to start the program with Kickstart/Lazyvim/Astronvim or Lua based plugins. Neovim run barebone is stable. It could caused by the Lua.dll. Dump is too big for github so I would send it here: https://www.mediafire.com/file/vuyht5vn115u58h/nvim01.rar/file ### Steps to reproduce Not sure what cause the error that make the program frozen/crashes. I would like to send the whole dump here for analyse. Install Kickstart or Lazyvim or astronvim. run neovim neovim display plugin install progress, everything seems OK. retart neovim and its either crash or frozen. ### Expected behavior It was expected to run smoothly and stable, either with a final version or nightly version. Nightly version installed with Lazyvim distro run smoothly on my old windows 10 Professional laptop. ### Nvim version (nvim -v) NVIM v0.12.0-dev-1034+gf363ea8547 ### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same? No, Vim run smoothly (vim 9.1 Included patches: 1-1652) ### Operating system/version windows 11 professional - Latest update ### Terminal name/version CMD ### $TERM environment variable (not available on windows) ### Installation Download from nightly release channel

comment_data.body:
Need to narrow it down to a specific plugin, else this is not actionable.

Some lazy plugins such as "noice" use luajit FFI which can cause crashes that aren't actually bugs in Nvim.

I'm tried to run WSL and neovim ran well, while switching to Windows then trouble happened.

Here is the screen capture:
https://youtu.be/i-umvgRxB-Y

> Neovim run barebone is stable. It could caused by the Lua.dll.

There is `$VIMRUNTIME/lua/vim/_defaults.lua` that is always sourced (even with "--clean"), so that's unlikely the reason. 

> Here is the screen capture:
https://youtu.be/i-umvgRxB-Y

That "screen capture" is a private video

I'm experiencing this same issue.

Has anyone been able to solve this?
we need a minimal reproduce step and if you got crash see `help dev-tools-backtrace` to find crash log

The issue appears when having Lua plugins on a normal user. For some reason on a superuser session, the problem is not present

EDIT: improved backtrace

The culprint is `blink.cmp`.

Having it loaded with the Rust fuzzy implementation breaks Neovim.

Apparently building the plugins throws an error:

```
        Compiling shlex v1.3.0
           Compiling autocfg v1.5.0
           Compiling proc-macro2 v1.0.95

           Compiling scopeguard v1.2.0

           Compiling either v1.15.0
           Compiling smallvec v1.15.1
           Compiling regex-syntax v0.8.5
           Compiling thiserror v2.0.16
           Compiling virtue v0.0.18
           Compiling cc v1.2.27
           Compiling constant_time_eq v0.3.1
           Compiling blink-cmp-fuzzy v0.1.0 (/home/sicro/.local/share/nvim/lazy/blink.cmp)
           Compiling rustc-hash v2.1.1
           Compiling arrayref v0.3.9
           Compiling arrayvec v0.7.6

           Compiling quote v1.0.40
           Compiling syn v2.0.104
           Compiling bincode v2.0.1

           Compiling blake3 v1.8.2
           Compiling crossbeam-deque v0.8.6
           Compiling parking_lot v0.12.4
           Compiling rayon v1.10.0
           Compiling regex-automata v0.4.9
           Compiling thiserror-impl v2.0.16
           Compiling mlua_derive v0.11.0
           Compiling frizbee v0.5.0
        error[E0554]: `#![feature]` may not be used on the stable release channel
         --> /home/sicro/.local/share/cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-1949cf8c6b5b557f/frizbee-0.5.0/src/lib.rs:2:1
          |
        2 | #![feature(avx512_target_feature)]
          | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ help: remove the attribute
          |
          = help: the feature `avx512_target_feature` has been stable since `1.89.0` and no longer requires an attribute to enable

        error[E0554]: `#![feature]` may not be used on the stable release channel

          |
        3 | #![feature(portable_simd)]
          | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

        error[E0554]: `#![feature]` may not be used on the stable release channel
         --> /home/sicro/.local/share/cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-1949cf8c6b5b557f/frizbee-0.5.0/src/lib.rs:4:1
          |
        4 | #![feature(get_mut_unchecked)]
          | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

           Compiling mlua v0.11.3
        For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0554`.
        error: could not compile `frizbee` (lib) due to 3 previous errors
        warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
```

Changing the options to this stops Neovim from crashing:

```lua
{
	'saghen/blink.cmp',
	opts = {
		fuzzy = {
			implementation = 'lua'
		}
	}
}
```

> The culprint is `blink.cmp`.
> 
> Having it loaded with the Rust fuzzy implementation breaks Neovim.

Thanks for narrowing that down. And it uses FFI: https://github.com/Saghen/blink.cmp/blob/327fff91fe6af358e990be7be1ec8b78037d2138/doc/development/architecture.md?plain=1#L6

FFI is NOT SUPPORTED except on a at-your-own-risk basis.

labels.description: issue reporting a crash or segfault
labels.name: bug-crash

title: Neovim crashes everytime I install Lua based plugins
